column1: Uchi////Uchi has taken over the old El Felix space right off Montrose. The exterior
column4: they've maintained the old El Felix signage
column5: and you have to squint closely to make out the chameleon Uchi logo. Going to Uchi (loosely translated to "inside the house" in Japanese) should feel like going to a personal dinner party. (Albeit a dinner party with loud noises and very trendy people.) Reservations are strongly recommended
column6: although Uchi leaves quite a few number of tables for open seating. If you don't have reservations and are coming during peak times
column7: expect to wait an hour plus.
